intellimate.izou.activator

Class Activator

  • java.lang.Object
    • intellimate.izou.activator.Activator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identifiable, ExceptionCallback, java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class Activator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, Identifiable, ExceptionCallback
    The Task of an Activator is to listen for whatever you choose to implement and fires events to notify a change.

    The Activator always runs in the Background, just overwrite activatorStarts(). To use Activator simply extend from it and hand an instance over to the ActivatorManager.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method implements runnable and should only be called by a Thread.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • activatorStarts

        public abstract void activatorStarts()
                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Starting an Activator causes this method to be called.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - will be caught by the Activator implementation, doesn't restart the activator

      • exceptionThrown

        public final void exceptionThrown(java.lang.Exception e)
        wrapper for terminated. This method counts the exceptions, if they are above the limit, doesn't call terminated
        Specified by:
        exceptionThrown in interface ExceptionCallback
        Parameters:
        e - if not null, the exception, which caused the termination

      • terminated

        public abstract boolean terminated(java.lang.Exception e)
        This method gets called when the Activator Thread got exceptionThrown.

        This is an unusual way of ending a thread. The main reason for this should be, that the activator was interrupted by an uncaught exception.

        Parameters:
        e - if not null, the exception, which caused the termination
        Returns:
        true if the Thread should be restarted

      • unregisterCaller

        public void unregisterCaller()
        unregister the Caller at the EventManager.

        If you don't need this class anymore, you should unregister the caller to avoid memory leaks.

      • fireEvent

        public void fireEvent(Event event)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      MultipleEventsException
        fires an Event.

        This triggers all the ContentGenerator instances, that have subscribed to the event. Note that if multiple events get fired simultaneously, a MultipleEventsException gets thrown.

        Parameters:
        event - the event to fire
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the event is null or empty
        MultipleEventsException - if there are other addons firing events

      • getCaller

        public LocalEventManager.EventCaller getCaller()
        returns the associated EventCaller
        Returns:
        the EventCaller

      • getContext

        public Context getContext()
        returns the Context of the AddOn. Context provides some general Communications.
        Returns:
        an instance of Context.

      • getIdentificationManager

        public IdentificationManager getIdentificationManager()
        get identification manager
        Returns:
        get identification manager
